item.description:
We'll discuss "True Love: A Practice for Awakening the Heart" by Thich Nhat Hanh and a short article from The New Yorker (January 17, 2011) "Social Animal" by David Brooks.
www.newyorker.com/reporting/2011/01/17/110117fa_fact_brooks

Also Nancy will present pages 25 to 51 in "A New Earth" by Eckhart Tolle. Would you like to check these pages before the meeting to refresh your memory?”

About the book "True Love: A Practice for Awakening the Heart" by Thich Nhat Hanh:

This is the book of March. It is a simple, yet deep book with valuable concepts about the nature of real love. The author explores the four key aspects of love as described in the Buddhist tradition: loving kindness, compassion, joy, and freedom - explaining how to experience them in our day-to-day lives. He also emphasizes that in order to love in a real way, we must first learn how to be fully present in our lives, and he offers simple techniques from the Buddhist tradition that anyone can use to establish the conditions of love.
item.why: "True Love: A Practice for Awakening the Heart" by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.name: April Meeting
